intro: Mimulus fremontii var. vandenbergensis, commonly known as the Vandenberg's monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Mimulus, which includes various species of flowering plants commonly referred to as monkeyflowers. This particular variety is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers, which are typically spurred at the back, a feature common in many Mimulus species. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in streambanks and meadows. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
